sentences.sContent: So we get at the number of neutrons indirectly because we know the proton number here.
sentences.sContent_eng: So we get at the number of neutrons indirectly because we know the proton number here.
sentences.sCn: 所以，我们可以间接得到中子数,因为我们知道质子数了。

sentences.sContent: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.sContent_eng: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.sCn: 原子内的一个中子衰变后会产生一个质子、一个电子和一个中微子。

sentences.sContent: Hydrogen, the most common molecule in the universe, is just two atoms—each with one proton and one electron.
sentences.sContent_eng: Hydrogen, the most common molecule in the universe, is just two atoms—each with one proton and one electron.
sentences.sCn: 是宇宙中最普通的分子，仅有两个原子构成，每个原子仅包含一个质子和一个电子。

trans.tranOther: a very small piece of matter with a positive electrical  charge  that is in the central part of an atom
